title: Reference template parsing order is non-deterministic

labels.name: bug
labels.description: Categorizes issue or PR as related to a bug.

body:
Reference template parsing order is non-deterministic, causing tpl function to render the wrong value in certain situations.

Output of `helm version`:
```
version.BuildInfo{Version:"v3.1.1", GitCommit:"afe70585407b420d0097d07b21c47dc511525ac8", GitTreeState:"clean", GoVersion:"go1.13.8"}
```

Output of `kubectl version`:
```
Client Version: version.Info{Major:"1", Minor:"15", GitVersion:"v1.15.5", GitCommit:"20c265fef0741dd71a66480e35bd69f18351daea", GitTreeState:"clean", BuildDate:"2019-10-15T19:16:51Z", GoVersion:"go1.12.10", Compiler:"gc", Platform:"darwin/amd64"}
Server Version: version.Info{Major:"1", Minor:"17", GitVersion:"v1.17.2+k3s1", GitCommit:"cdab19b09a84389ffbf57bebd33871c60b1d6b28", GitTreeState:"clean", BuildDate:"2020-01-27T18:09:26Z", GoVersion:"go1.13.6", Compiler:"gc", Platform:"linux/amd64"}
```

Cloud Provider/Platform (AKS, GKE, Minikube etc.): 
```
k3s
```

Minimal code to reproduce the issue:

[chart.zip](https://github.com/helm/helm/files/4264859/chart.zip)

```
$ unzip chart.zip
$ for i in $(seq 0 99); do helm template test01 parent >> results.txt; done
$ grep 'childName: test01-child' results.txt | wc -l
$ grep 'childName: test01-parent' results.txt | wc -l
```

I am seeing an average split of 80/20% between the values.

PR to come.
